public class MediaGroupUnjoinTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Testcases involving media operations on a Mediagroup that is not properly joined to a NetworkConnection or MediaMixer.

Method Detail

test_2_2_4_1_UnjoinMGPlay

public void test_2_2_4_1_UnjoinMGPlay()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Play while MediaGroup is unjoined.

Two media groups are connected/joined with looped NetworkConnections. One acts as player and the other MG as signal detector.

MG(player)---->looped NCs----->MG(signal detector)

In the first run, signal is detected by the Signal detector after the player starts. Then the looped NC is unjoined from the player MG. In the second run, the player plays the same media file which contains the signal, and no signal should be detected on the detector MG. Two behaviours are acceptable: either an exception, or playing as usual

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_4_2_UnjoinMGRecord

public void test_2_2_4_2_UnjoinMGRecord()
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Record while MediaGroup is unjoined.

Two media groups are connected/joined with looped NetworkConnections. One acts as player and the other MG as recorder.

MG(player)---->looped NCs----->MG(recorder)

In the first run, the recorder receives stream from player. Then the looped NC is unjoined from the recorder MG. By the second run, the recorder can not receive stream from player via NCs anymore, The recorder can record silence or throw a JoinException, depending on the implementation.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_4_3_UnjoinMGSignalDetector

public void test_2_2_4_3_UnjoinMGSignalDetector()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Detecting signals while the MediaGroup is unjoined.

Two MediaGroups are connected/joined with looped NetworkConnections.
One acts as player and the other as signal detector.
MG(player)---->looped NCs----->MG(signal detector)
In the first run, a signal is detected by the Signal detector after the player starts.
Then the looped NC is unjoined from the Detector MG.
On the second run, the player plays the same media file which contains the signal, and no signal should be detected on the detector MG:
Either receiveSignals throws a JoinException, or it completes normally with INITIAL_TIMEOUT_EXCEEDED.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
